setTags

public void setTags()
Extract all Tags from the input data and put it the arraylist. Does this by running all the inputTags through all the registered tags via a inner for-clause.

Parameters:
void -

public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getTags()

getEntryswithTags

public java.util.ArrayList<Entry> getEntryswithTags(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> tags,
                                                    java.util.ArrayList<Entry> inputEntrys)
This methods returns either an empty arraylist or an arraylist with the objects on which all tags matched. At first it searchs trough all the entrys and uses that that subset to check against the other tags.

Parameters:
tags - ArrayList containig Tags as String, ArrayList inputEntrys
Returns:
ArrayList with Entrys or empty ArrayList

getEntryswithUsername

public java.util.ArrayList<Entry> getEntryswithUsername(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> usernames,
                                                        java.util.ArrayList<Entry> inputEntrys)
This methods returns either an empty arraylist or an arraylist with the objects on which all usernames matched. At first it searchs trough all the entrys and uses that that subset to check against the other usernames.

Parameters:
tags - ArrayList containig usernames as String, ArrayList inputEntrys
Returns:
ArrayList with Entrys or empty ArrayList

getEntrysOnDay

public java.util.ArrayList<Entry> getEntrysOnDay(java.util.Date date,
                                                 java.util.ArrayList<Entry> inputEntrys)
This method checks for any entrys which were added on that date, but checks only for day, month and year.

Parameters:
java.util.Date - date, ArrayList inputEntrys
Returns:
ArrayList with Entrys or empty ArrayList
